Usage¶

Basic Usage¶

Here’s a basic example of how to use the package:

from ordinal_xai import load_model
from ordinal_xai.interpretation import LIME, LOCO
import pandas as pd

# Load your data
data = pd.read_csv('your_data.csv')
X = data.drop('target', axis=1)
y = data['target']

# Load and train a model
model = load_model('CLM', link='logit')
model.fit(X, y)

# Create an interpretation
interpreter = LIME(model)
explanation = interpreter.explain(X.iloc[0])

# Visualize the explanation
interpreter.plot_explanation(explanation)

Command Line Arguments¶

The package can also be used from the command line:

python -m ordinal_xai.main --dataset your_data.csv --model CLM --interpretation LIME

Available arguments:

  • --dataset: Dataset filename in ‘data/’ folder (default: ‘dummy.csv’)

  • --model: Model filename (without .py) in ‘models/’ folder (default: ‘CLM’)

  • --interpretation: Interpretability method filename (without .py) in ‘interpretation/’ folder

  • --model_params: JSON string of model parameters

  • --interpretation_params: JSON string of interpretation parameters

  • --observation_idx: Index of the observation to interpret (only for local explanations)

  • --features: Comma-separated list of feature indices to include in the explanation

ordinal_xai
